result.execSummary:
The defendant Amir Alex Afsharjavan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amir Alex Afsharjavan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amir Alex Afsharjavan was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amir Alex Afsharjavan

defendant.name: Afsharjavan, Amir Alex

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: c: Def, Atty, DA & SSPD. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: LiddleADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Robert A Wertheimer   DF:  Amir Alex Afsharjavan appeared. Case called at 11:11 a.m. ADA McKinley states there is a resolution. Recites agreement. Atty Wertheimer in agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 2 Poss. of THC in 15CM315 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 Poss. of THC in 15CM315. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CM315. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- $500.00 fine inclusive of costs and surcharges. Bond to apply.

- Provide DNA Sample

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis McKinley   DF ATTY:  Robert A Wertheimer   DF:  Amir Alex Afsharjavan did not appear. Case called at 11:11 a.m. ADA McKinley requesting bench warrant be issued and stayed. Court will issue warrant and stay.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Evenson. ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY: Robert A Wertheimer DF: Amir Alex Afsharjavan appeared. Case called at 3:36. ADA McKinley updates the court and requests another PTC date for a possible resolution. Atty. Wertheimer agrees. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Unlawfully Obtained Evidence. Filed by Atty Wertheimer. km
filed by ADA A. McKinley. gme
